page.title: 07K. P. NUT FACTORY
page.content: {K.P.}stands for{Kenyon Products.}The site was built in{1948}as a pickle factory covering four and a half acres. K.P. is the{biggest nut factory {in the world}outside the U.S.A. There are 289{people employed}in a shift system. The 10.00 p.m. to 6.00 a.m. shift is the{cleaning time when they {check}the machines. Peanuts are {imported}from Sweden, U.S.A., South Africa, Spain, Turkey and Australia. The biggest nut growing Country in the world is{India.}K.P. pack{1,000,000 {nuts}a day. They{export}them all over the world including Scandinavia and the Far East. The workers are not allowed to wear jewellry but they must wear a{hair net}and{hats.}Peanuts do not grow on trees, they grow underground. They are{salted}before they are roasted in machines, where their skins are{peeled.
